channel.title: How to stop spammers, and not impair the good customer experience
channel.description:
Hello,
Recently we had to spend some time on fighting email spammers, who used "Share" function of [Checkvist](https://checkvist.com) to send emails with hand-crafted "share note".
The summary of what worked for us is here: http://blog.checkvist.com/post/166940442968/how-to-stop-spammers-and-not-impair-the-good
What did not work:
- blocking spammer IPs (they have plenty resources, really) - adding limitations by a number of sent invitations (they created different lists, different accounts, removed and re-created invitations) - avoiding sending many emails to a particular domain (qq.com is the famous one).
Maybe our experience will be useful to some of the people here :slight_smile:
Best, KIR

I hope they have not yet worked around invisible reCAPTURE as of 2017.

When this reCAPTURE is unsure if you’re a human you should identify some objects on several pictures. I don’t think it can be solved by IA yet. It may be cheaper to hire some poor mechanical turks to pass the capture than to use IA.

item.dc:creator: rfctr
item.description:
So email verification and reCAPTCHA?

Spammers can verify the source emails, can’t they?

And reCAPTCHA… I do not really know how it works, but I recently heard a neural network was trained to work around reCAPTCHA.

So… do not relax as of yet.
